com.busit

Interface IConnector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Connector

    public interface IConnector
    This is the basic routable interface for connectors. See Connector.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(Map<String,String> config,
        Map<String,Map<String,String>> inputs,
        Map<String,Map<String,String>> outputs)
        Step 1. This method is called by the broker in order to initialize this connector instance. You should consider this method as the constructor and you should not perform any process before cron(IMessage, String) or setInput(IMessage, String) !
        Parameters:
        config - the key/value pair of all configuration parameters
        inputs - the list of all input interfaces (see note for format)
        outputs - the list of all output interfaces (see note for format)
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - you should throw if anything goes wrong so that the user can be alerted.
        Note:
        The interface (input and output) format is as follows :
        • The Map key is the name of the interface as given by the user. This is the interfaceId that will be used in cron(IMessage, String), getOutput(String) and setInput(IMessage, String).
        • Each Map value is again a Map containing :
          • key : the internal name of the interface as you defined it in the connector configuration
          • value : the eventual value of the interface if it is a dynamic one, else null

      • cron

        void cron(IMessage message,
        String interfaceId)
        Step 2a. This method is called by the broker when an automatic timer occurs as setup by the user. This method is called first in order to prepare required data and then only the corresponding output is considered when calling getOutput(String), all other links on other output interfaces are not triggered.
        Parameters:
        interfaceId - the name of the output interface to consider
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - you should throw if you do not support cron.
        RuntimeException - you should throw if anything goes wrong so that the user can be alerted.

      • setInput

        void setInput(IMessage message,
            String interfaceId)
        Step 2b. This method is called by the broker when a message is sent by the user. This method is called first in order to prepare required data and then all possible output interfaces linked by the user are triggered by calling getOutput(String).
        Parameters:
        message - the encrypted message of the user
        interfaceId - the name of the input interface to consider
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - you should throw if the interfaceId is invalid.
        RuntimeException - you should throw if anything goes wrong so that the user can be alerted.
        See Also:
        IMessage

      • getOutput

        IMessage getOutput(String interfaceId)
        Step 3. This method is called by the broker in order to retrieve the message to forward to the next linked connector. This method is always called after either cron(IMessage, String) or setInput(IMessage, String)
        Parameters:
        interfaceId - the name of the output interface to consider
        Returns:
        The message with proper content, or null if there is no data.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - you should throw if the interfaceId is invalid.
        RuntimeException - you should throw if anything goes wrong so that the user can be alerted.
        See Also:
        IMessage

      • getSampleData

        IMessage getSampleData(IMessage message,
                     String interfaceId)
        This method is called when the user wants to simulate data production in order to test his scenario. This method should return a static hard-coded message. If your connector does not produce any data, just return null. Note that this metod will always be called after init(Map, Map, Map) so you can rely on a fully populated configuration.
        Parameters:
        message - an empty template message to fill-in
        interfaceId - the name of the output interface to consider
        Returns:
        The message with proper sample content, or null if there is no data.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - you should throw if the interfaceId is invalid.
        RuntimeException - you should throw if anything goes wrong so that the user can be alerted.
        See Also:
        IMessage

      • isFunctional

        boolean isFunctional(Map<String,String> config,
                   Map<String,Map<String,String>> inputs,
                   Map<String,Map<String,String>> outputs)
                     throws Exception
        This method is called internally for time to time in order to test if the conector works. You should build unit tests for your connector in this method and check for external resources or anything you rely on. Note that this method will be called just after the constructor, thus the init(Map, Map, Map) method will not be called. Instead, you will be provided the config, inputs and outputs parameters directly. This method is intented to test if your connector works as is, not as part of a scenario. Thus the runtime instance of your implementation is to be considered as an anonymous instance : the config, inputs and outputs will be defaults as you declared them, and not customized by the user. Thus if you rely on OAuth or specific configuration process values or else, those will not be available.
        Parameters:
        config - the key/value pair of all configuration parameters. The value will be null unless you have provided defaults.
        inputs - the list of all input interfaces, the name is the same as the key and the value is null unless you have provided defaults.
        outputs - the list of all output interfaces, the name is the same as the key and the value is null unless you have provided defaults.
        Returns:
        true if the connector should work properly, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        Exception - Any exception is allowed to be thrown and is considered as a failure equivalent to returning false. However, throwing an exception allows to mention a specific cause that will eventually help troubleshooting.

      • notifyUser

        void notifyUser(String message)
        This method should be implemented to report errors or warnings to the end user.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to report to the user (consider translations)

      • notifyOwner

        void notifyOwner(String message,
               Map<String,Object> data)
        This method should be implemented to report errors or warnings to the owner of the implementation.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to report to the owner (consider translations)
        data - any additionnal data that can be useful
